intro: Pycnocoma bampsiana, commonly known as the Bampsian pycnocoma, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, often in rocky or alpine areas. Its foliage is dense and hairy, which helps protect it from harsh weather conditions. The flowers are small and yellow, often arranged in a clustered inflorescence.
